alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Coos, east central Grafton and north central Carroll Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lincoln, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethlehem, Lincoln, Franconia, Woodstock, Carroll, Bartlett, Jackson, Albany, Thornton, Waterville Valley, Livermore and Hart`s Location. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 99 and 102, and between mile markers 104 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos
